class Page

Detailed Description

A Scene is used to build a visual interface. 

  class MyPage : public gaia::core::Page {
    public:
      gaia::core::Button* mpBtn1;
      gaia::core::Button* mpBtn2;
      gaia::core::LinearLayout* mpController;
      virtual void onInit(Persistence* p);
      virtual void onTear();
      . . .
  };
  //In your Page onInit to customized your layout and attach to Scene.
  void MyPage::onInit(gaia::core::Persistence* p) {
      mpController = new gaia::core::LinearLayout(this);
      if (mpController != NULL) {
          mpBtn1 = new gaia::core::Button(this);
          if (mpBtn1 != NULL) {
             mpController->addWidget(mpBtn1);
          } else {
             GLOGE("Button1 create failed!!!");
          }
          mpBtn2 = new gaia::core::Button(this);
          if (mpBtn2 != NULL) {
             mpController->addWidget(mpBtn2);
          } else {
             GLOGE("Button2 create failed!!!");
          }
          //Create Scene instance by SceneFactory
          gaia::core::Scene* scene = gaia::core::Scene::SceneFactory();
          if (scene != NULL) {
              //attach controller to scene to show on screen
              scene->attachAndSetupSceneLayout(controller);
          } else {
              GLOGE("Scene create failed!!!");
          }
     }
  }

  //In your page onTear to destroy scene to avoid memory leak.
  void MyPage::onTear() {
      //You could direct get the scene instance by Page API of getSceneSingleton()
      //for each page only have 1 scene instance.
      gaia::core::Scene* scene = getSceneSingleton();
      if (scene != NULL) {
          scene->SceneDestroy();
      } else {
          GLOGW("WARNING!! Scene could not destory normally and may cause leakage");
      }
  }

Definition at line 124 of file Scene.h.

anonymous enum
Enumerator:
SCENE_NO_TITLE 

This feature must be requested before setupSceneLayout and can not be turned off once it is requested.

Hide title bar.

SCENE_PROGRESS 

Flag for the progress indicator feature.

SCENE_FULL_SCREEN 

Hide all screen decorations.

SCENE_STATUS_BAR_TRANSPARENT 

Hide status bar.

SCENE_INDETERMINATE_PROGRESS 

Flag for indeterminate progress.

SCENE_ACTION_BAR 

This feature must be requested before setupSceneLayout and can not be turned off once it is requested.

SCENE_ACTION_BAR_OVERLAY 

This feature must be requested before setupSceneLayout and can not be turned off once it is requested.

SCENE_LAYOUT_NO_LIMIT 

Allow window to extend outside of the screen.

SCENE_KEEP_SCREEN_ON 

as long as this window is visible to the user, keep the device's screen turned on and bright.

SCENE_SHOW_WHEN_LOCKED 

special flag to let windows be shown when the screen is locked.

SCENE_DISMISS_KEYGUARD 

When set the window will cause the keyguard to be dismissed, only if it is not a secure lock keyguard.

void gaia::core::Scene::setBackgroundDrawer ( gaia::graphics::Drawer *  drawer)

Change the background of this window to a custom Drawer.

Setting the background to null will make the window be opaque. To make the window transparent, you can use an empty drawer (for instance a ColorDrawer with the color 0 or the system drawer gaia:drawer/empty.)

Parameters:
drawerThe new Drawer to use for this window's background.
void gaia::core::Scene::setFeatureDrawer ( int32_t  featureID,
const gaia::graphics::Drawer *  drawer 
)

Set an explicit Drawer value for feature of this window.

You must have called requestSceneFeature(featureID) before calling this function.

Parameters:
featureIDThe desired drawer feature to change. Features are constants defined.
drawerA Drawer object to display.
void gaia::core::Scene::setFeatureDrawerAlpha ( int32_t  featureID,
int32_t  alpha 
)

Set a custom alpha value for the given drawer feature, controlling how much the background is visible through it.

Parameters:
featureIDThe desired drawer feature to change. Features are constants defined.
alphaThe alpha amount, 0 is completely transparent and 255 is completely opaque.
void gaia::core::Scene::setFeatureDrawerResource ( int32_t  featureID,
int32_t  resID 
)

Set the value for a drawer feature of this window, from a resource identifier.

You must have called requestSceneFeature(featureID) before calling this function.

Parameters:
featureIDThe desired drawer feature to change, defined as a constant.
resIDResource identifier of the desired image.
void gaia::core::Scene::setFeatureDrawerUri ( int32_t  featureID,
const gaia::net::Uri &  uri 
)

Set the value for a drawer feature of this window, from a URI.

You must have called requestSceneFeature(featureID) before calling this function. The only URI currently supported is "content:", specifying an image in a content provider.

Parameters:
featureIDThe desired drawer feature to change. Features are constants defined.
uriThe desired URI.
void gaia::core::Scene::setFormat ( int32_t  format)

Set the format of window, as per the PixelFormat types.

This overrides the default format that is selected by the Window based on its window decorations.

Parameters:
formatThe new window format (see PixelFormat). Use PixelFormat.UNKNOWN to allow the Window to select the format.
void gaia::core::Scene::setSoftInputMode ( int32_t  mode)

Specify an explicit soft input mode to use for the window.

Providing anything besides "unspecified" here will override the input mode the window would normally retrieve from its theme.

Parameters:
modeThe input mode.
